pullRequest.title: Create assertions for Pioneer (#232)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Created assertions for Pioneers ExecutionResults class with a (hopefully) intuitive fluent API.
Closes #232

I hereby agree to the terms of the JUnit Pioneer Contributor License Agreement.

commit.message: Created PioneerAssert in a container class (fluent API is hard). Rewrote tests using the new assertions.

nodes.bodyText:
i am not sure if the and is really needed, and it is not really common in assertJ. i think hasException should be fine, or maybe withException.
not 100% sure but i think we should align this with https://joel-costigliola.github.io/assertj/assertj-core-features-highlight.html#exception-assertion . so it is really concise and easy to understand, when you know assertj already
i might suggest to have one basic method like hasNumberOfFailedTests(int number) and than just use that within this method. as i think this assert might be usable for other cases in the future too.

commit.message: WIP commit. Moved assertion class to separate package.

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/junit-pioneer/junit-pioneer into issue/232-pioneer-assert

 Conflicts:
	src/test/java/org/junitpioneer/jupiter/ReportEntryExtensionTest.java
Implementation of an experimental approach to asserting Pioneer assertions.

nodes.bodyText: could we actually use https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/master/src/main/java/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractThrowableAssert.java instead of that assert - it does have already a lot of functionality and we would stick to the default

commit.message: Added some more paths to the assertions for better readability.
Added EntryPoint for both generic and Pioneer specific assertions.
Added static import for `assertThat` in PioneerAssert

Spotless. Again.
I dedicate this commit to Set, the ancient Egyptian god of rage.
This commit is basically a guess.

Refactored Pioneer assertions to be simpler, easier to use.

Signed-off-by: Mihaly Verhas <misi.verhas@gmail.com>
